required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pemetrexed and Best Supportive Care Versus Placebo and Best Supportive Care in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of Maintenance Pemetrexed Plus Best Supportive Care Versus Best Supportive Care Immediately Following Induction Treatment for Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized Phase 3, double-blind study of maintenance pemetrexed plus best supportive care versus placebo plus best supportive care in NSCLC. Participants must have received 1 of 6 induction regimens for 4 cycles and did not have progressive disease prior to randomization (enrollment) into this trial.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured PD or death from any cause (up to 41 months)
primary_outcome.description: PFS time was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of objective progression of disease or death from any cause. PFS was censored at the date of the participant's last tumor assessment for participants who were not known to have died or to have PD as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis. PD, defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.0 (RECIST v1.0), was at least a 20% increase in the sum of longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as references the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to date of death from any cause (up to 41 months)
secondary_outcome.description: OS time was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. OS was censored at the last date of contact for participants who were not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured PD (up to 41 months)
secondary_outcome.description: TPD was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of objective PD. TPD was censored at the date of the participant's last tumor assessment for participants who were not known to have PD as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis or who died without objective PD. PD, defined using RECIST v1.0, was at least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to worsening of each LCSS item (up to 39 months)
secondary_outcome.description: TWS was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of worsening [defined as a 15-millimeter (mm) increase from baseline based on a 100-mm scale] of each symptom and summary item in the Lung Cancer Symptom Scale (LCSS). The participant-reported LCSS was a 9-item questionnaire. Six items were symptom-specific measures for lung cancer (loss of appetite, fatigue, cough, dyspnea, hemoptysis, and pain), and 3 summation items described total symptomatic distress, interference with activity level, and global quality of life. Participant (pt) responses to each item were measured using visual analogue scales (VAS) from 0 (for best outcome) to 100 (for worst outcome). TWS was censored at the date of the last LCSS assessment for pts who were not known to have LCSS worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Objective Tumor Response Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to measured PD (up to 41 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined using RECIST v1.0 criteria. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined either A) at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the LD of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LDs or B) complete disappearance of target lesions, with persistence (but not worsening) of 1 or more nontarget lesions. In either case, no new lesions may have appeared. The percentage of participants with CR or PR=(Number of participants with CR or PR)/(Number of participants assessed)*100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to study completion (up to 41 Months)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically significant events were defined as serious adverse events (SAEs) and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality. A summary of serious and other non-serious AEs, regardless of causality, is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Improvement Over Baseline in Individual Symptom Scores and Quality of Life Using the LCSS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post discontinuation of study treatment (up to 39 Months)
secondary_outcome.description: The participant-reported LCSS was a 9-item questionnaire. Six items were symptom-specific measures for lung cancer (loss of appetite, fatigue, cough, dyspnea, hemoptysis, and pain), and 3 summation items described total symptomatic distress, interference with activity level, and global quality of life. Participant responses to each item were measured using VAS from 0 (for best outcome) to 100 (for worst outcome). The average symptom burden index (ASBI) was the mean of the 6 symptom-specific items. The LCSS total score was the mean of the 9 items.

intervention.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2), intravenous (IV) administration, every (q) 21 days, until disease progression
Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologic or cytologic diagnosis of NSCLC Stage IIIB (with pleural effusion and/or positive supraclavicular lymph nodes) or Stage IV prior to induction therapy.
- Participants must have had 1 of the following induction therapies for treatment for Stage IIIB (with pleural effusion and/or positive supraclavicular lymph nodes) or IV NSCLC: Gemcitabine plus carboplatin, paclitaxel plus carboplatin, or docetaxel plus carboplatin, gemcitabine plus cisplatin, paclitaxel plus cisplatin or docetaxel plus cisplatin.
- Participants must have received only 1 chemotherapeutic doublet lasting precisely 4 cycles.
- Induction regimens must be based on 21-day cycles.
- Documented evidence of a tumor response of complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD). Tumor assessment must occur between Cycle 4 (Day 1) of induction therapy and the date of randomization. This response does not have to be confirmed in order for the participant to be randomized. Positron emission tomography (PET) scans and ultrasounds may not be used for lesion measurements for response determination.
Exclusion Criteria:
- With the exception of those chemotherapies listed as inclusion criterion, participants will not be included if they have received prior systemic anticancer therapy (including adjuvant early-stage treatment for NSCLC) or any systemic treatment for any other cancer.
- Have received treatment within the last 30 days with a drug that has not received regulatory approval for any indication at the time of study entry.
- Inability to comply with protocol or study procedures.
- A serious concomitant systemic disorder that would compromise the participant's ability to complete the study.
- A serious cardiac condition, such as myocardial infarction within 6 months, angina, or heart disease, as defined by the New York Heart Association Class III or IV.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who signed the informed consent form (ICF) and completed the randomized process are presented in the participant flow by the treatment arm to which they were randomized. Participants who did not sign the ICF or complete the randomization process were removed from the database and excluded from all analyses.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2), intravenous (IV) administration, every (q) 21 days, until disease progression. Best Supportive Care (BSC): Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

milestone.title: Received at Least 1 Dose of Study Drug

participants_list.participants: Four participants randomized to placebo received pemetrexed.

baseline.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Time
outcome.description: PFS time was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of objective progression of disease or death from any cause. PFS was censored at the date of the participant‚Äôs last tumor assessment for participants who were not known to have died or to have PD as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis. PD, defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.0 (RECIST v1.0), was at least a 20% increase in the sum of longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as references the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured PD or death from any cause (up to 41 months)
outcome.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized. Participants censored: N = 123, 36 participants in the pemetrexed and placebo treatment arms, respectively.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Time
measure.description: PFS time was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of objective progression of disease or death from any cause. PFS was censored at the date of the participant‚Äôs last tumor assessment for participants who were not known to have died or to have PD as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis. PD, defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.0 (RECIST v1.0), was at least a 20% increase in the sum of longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as references the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
measure.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized. Participants censored: N = 123, 36 participants in the pemetrexed and placebo treatment arms, respectively.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS) Time
outcome.description: OS time was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. OS was censored at the last date of contact for participants who were not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to date of death from any cause (up to 41 months)
outcome.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized. Participants censored: N = 138, 48 participants in the pemetrexed and placebo treatment arms, respectively.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS) Time
measure.description: OS time was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. OS was censored at the last date of contact for participants who were not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis.
measure.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized. Participants censored: N = 138, 48 participants in the pemetrexed and placebo treatment arms, respectively.

outcome.title: Time to Objective Progressive Disease (TPD)
outcome.description: TPD was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of objective PD. TPD was censored at the date of the participant‚Äôs last tumor assessment for participants who were not known to have PD as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis or who died without objective PD. PD, defined using RECIST v1.0, was at least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured PD (up to 41 months)
outcome.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized. Participants censored: N = 145, 40 participants in the pemetrexed and placebo treatment arms, respectively.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

measure.title: Time to Objective Progressive Disease (TPD)
measure.description: TPD was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of objective PD. TPD was censored at the date of the participant‚Äôs last tumor assessment for participants who were not known to have PD as of the data-inclusion cut-off date for analysis or who died without objective PD. PD, defined using RECIST v1.0, was at least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
measure.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized. Participants censored: N = 145, 40 participants in the pemetrexed and placebo treatment arms, respectively.

outcome.title: Time to Worsening of Symptoms (TWS)
outcome.description: TWS was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of worsening [defined as a 15-millimeter (mm) increase from baseline based on a 100-mm scale] of each symptom and summary item in the Lung Cancer Symptom Scale (LCSS). The participant-reported LCSS was a 9-item questionnaire. Six items were symptom-specific measures for lung cancer (loss of appetite, fatigue, cough, dyspnea, hemoptysis, and pain), and 3 summation items described total symptomatic distress, interference with activity level, and global quality of life. Participant (pt) responses to each item were measured using visual analogue scales (VAS) from 0 (for best outcome) to 100 (for worst outcome). TWS was censored at the date of the last LCSS assessment for pts who were not known to have LCSS worsening.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to worsening of each LCSS item (up to 39 months)
outcome.population: Pts who signed ICF and completed randomization, according to treatment randomized. Pts censored: Loss of appetite 236,140; fatigue 237,130; cough 274,146; dyspnea 271,143, hemoptysis 404,198; pain 271,135; symptom distress 247,141; interference with activity level 267,141, global quality of life 262,137 pts in pemetrexed, placebo arm, respectively.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

measure.title: Time to Worsening of Symptoms (TWS)
measure.description: TWS was the elapsed time from the date of randomization to the first date of worsening [defined as a 15-millimeter (mm) increase from baseline based on a 100-mm scale] of each symptom and summary item in the Lung Cancer Symptom Scale (LCSS). The participant-reported LCSS was a 9-item questionnaire. Six items were symptom-specific measures for lung cancer (loss of appetite, fatigue, cough, dyspnea, hemoptysis, and pain), and 3 summation items described total symptomatic distress, interference with activity level, and global quality of life. Participant (pt) responses to each item were measured using visual analogue scales (VAS) from 0 (for best outcome) to 100 (for worst outcome). TWS was censored at the date of the last LCSS assessment for pts who were not known to have LCSS worsening.
measure.population: Pts who signed ICF and completed randomization, according to treatment randomized. Pts censored: Loss of appetite 236,140; fatigue 237,130; cough 274,146; dyspnea 271,143, hemoptysis 404,198; pain 271,135; symptom distress 247,141; interference with activity level 267,141, global quality of life 262,137 pts in pemetrexed, placebo arm, respectively.

measurement_list.measurement: Median (95% confidence interval) TWS for hemoptysis was not calculated due to the high level of censoring.
Median (95% confidence interval) TWS for hemoptysis was not calculated due to the high level of censoring.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Objective Tumor Response Rate)
outcome.description: Response was defined using RECIST v1.0 criteria. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined either A) at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the LD of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LDs or B) complete disappearance of target lesions, with persistence (but not worsening) of 1 or more nontarget lesions. In either case, no new lesions may have appeared. The percentage of participants with CR or PR=(Number of participants with CR or PR)/(Number of participants assessed)*100.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to measured PD (up to 41 months)
outcome.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Objective Tumor Response Rate)
measure.description: Response was defined using RECIST v1.0 criteria. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined either A) at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the LD of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LDs or B) complete disappearance of target lesions, with persistence (but not worsening) of 1 or more nontarget lesions. In either case, no new lesions may have appeared. The percentage of participants with CR or PR=(Number of participants with CR or PR)/(Number of participants assessed)*100.
measure.population: Participants who signed the ICF and completed the randomized process are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Clinically significant events were defined as serious adverse events (SAEs) and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality. A summary of serious and other non-serious AEs, regardless of causality, is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to study completion (up to 41 Months)
outcome.population: Participants who signed the ICF, completed the randomized process and received at least 1 dose of study drug are reported according to the treatment to which they were received.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: Clinically significant events were defined as serious adverse events (SAEs) and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality. A summary of serious and other non-serious AEs, regardless of causality, is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.
measure.population: Participants who signed the ICF, completed the randomized process and received at least 1 dose of study drug are reported according to the treatment to which they were received.

outcome.title: Maximum Improvement Over Baseline in Individual Symptom Scores and Quality of Life Using the LCSS
outcome.description: The participant-reported LCSS was a 9-item questionnaire. Six items were symptom-specific measures for lung cancer (loss of appetite, fatigue, cough, dyspnea, hemoptysis, and pain), and 3 summation items described total symptomatic distress, interference with activity level, and global quality of life. Participant responses to each item were measured using VAS from 0 (for best outcome) to 100 (for worst outcome). The average symptom burden index (ASBI) was the mean of the 6 symptom-specific items. The LCSS total score was the mean of the 9 items.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post discontinuation of study treatment (up to 39 Months)
outcome.population: Participants who signed the ICF, completed the randomization process, had LCSS data at baseline and at least once postdose are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized.

group.title: Pemetrexed and BSC
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

group.title: Placebo and BSC
group.description: Placebo: IV administration, q 21 days. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

measure.title: Maximum Improvement Over Baseline in Individual Symptom Scores and Quality of Life Using the LCSS
measure.description: The participant-reported LCSS was a 9-item questionnaire. Six items were symptom-specific measures for lung cancer (loss of appetite, fatigue, cough, dyspnea, hemoptysis, and pain), and 3 summation items described total symptomatic distress, interference with activity level, and global quality of life. Participant responses to each item were measured using VAS from 0 (for best outcome) to 100 (for worst outcome). The average symptom burden index (ASBI) was the mean of the 6 symptom-specific items. The LCSS total score was the mean of the 9 items.
measure.population: Participants who signed the ICF, completed the randomization process, had LCSS data at baseline and at least once postdose are reported according to the treatment arm to which they were randomized.

reported_events.desc: Participants are reported under the treatment to which they received.

group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m^2, IV administration, q 21 days, until disease progression. BSC: Treatment without a specific antineoplastic regimen, given with the intent to maximize quality of life, as judged by the treating physician.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Four participants (pts) assigned to placebo received pemetrexed; pts analyzed for efficacy as randomized. Three treated pts did not sign ICF, 1 treated pt signed ICF but did not complete entire randomization process; pts excluded from all analyses.
